tagline: Manage email campaigns, subscribers and design templates.
description: SendGrid is a cloud-based SMTP provider that allows you to send email without having to maintain email servers.

events.name: webhookEvent
events.description: This method is called every time an email event occurs in SendGrid
steps: Navigate to https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings in your sendgrid account and find the 'Event Notification' section
Under the Event notification section, change the HTTP POST URL to the following URL: __WEBHOOK_URL__

args.name: token
args.info: Token sent on each message

blocks.name: createCampaign
blocks.description: Create a marketing campaign.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: title
args.info: The title of your camapign.

args.name: subject
args.info: The Email subject of your camapign.

args.name: sender_id
args.info: The sender ID obtained from Sender Management.

args.name: list_ids
args.info: The list IDs, which will receive your email. You can indicate more than one list with comma-separated.

args.name: segment_ids
args.info: The segment IDs, which will receive your email. You can indicate more than one segment with comma-separated.

args.name: categories
args.info: This is a category that you can set for your emails. You can create up to 10 different categories with comma-separated.

args.name: suppression_group_id
args.info: The suppression group ID.

args.name: custom_unsubscribe_url
args.info: The custom unsubscribe URL.

args.name: ip_pool
args.info: The name of pool IP.

args.name: html_content
args.info: The HTML content of campaign.

args.name: plain_content
args.info: The plain text of campaign.

blocks.name: getCampaigns
blocks.description: Returns campaigns in reverse order they were created (newest first). Returns an empty array if no campaigns exist.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of results you would like to receive at a time. Default: 10

args.name: offset
args.info: The index of the first campaign to return, where 0 is the first campaign. Default 0

blocks.name: getCampaign
blocks.description: Get details about a specific campaign.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: campaign_id
args.info: The id of the campaign.

blocks.name: getSpamReportsList
blocks.description: List all spam reports.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: start_time
args.info: Refers start of the time range in unix timestamp when a spam report was created (inclusive).

args.name: end_time
args.info: Refers end of the time range in unix timestamp when a spam report was created (inclusive).

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the number of results to be displayed per page.

args.name: offset
args.info: Paging offset. The point in the list to begin displaying results.

blocks.name: deleteSpamReports
blocks.description: You can delete all spam reports by setting "delete_all" to true in the request body.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: delete_all
args.info: delete all spam reports by setting to 'true'. Default 'false'.

args.name: emails
args.info: delete some spam reports by specifying the comma-separated email addresses.

blocks.name: getSpamReport
blocks.description: Get a specific spam report.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: email
args.info: Email address of spam report entry.

blocks.name: deleteSpamReport
blocks.description: Delete a specific spam report.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: email
args.info: Email address of spam report entry.

blocks.name: getListRecipientsList
blocks.description: Get a list of the recipients on a specific list.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: list_id
args.info: The ID of the list.

args.name: page
args.info: Page index of first recipient to return (must be a positive integer). Default: 1.

args.name: page_size
args.info: Number of recipients to return at a time (must be a positive integer between 1 and 1000). Default: 100.

blocks.name: addListRecipient
blocks.description: Individual recipients may be added to a list one at a time with a limit of 1000 requests per second, where one recipient is added to the list per request.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: list_id
args.info: The ID of the list.

args.name: recipient_id
args.info: The ID of your existing recipient.

blocks.name: deleteListRecipient
blocks.description: Delete a single recipient from a single list.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: list_id
args.info: The ID of the list.

args.name: recipient_id
args.info: The ID of your existing recipient.

blocks.name: addListRecipients
blocks.description: Adds existing recipients to a list, passing in the recipient IDs to add. Recipient IDs should be passed exactly as they are returned from recipient endpoints. Note: The rate at which recipients may be added to a list is limited to 1 request per second. Recipients may be added in batches of 1000.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: list_id
args.info: The ID of the list.

args.name: recipient_id
args.info: List of recipient IDs

blocks.name: addRecipient
blocks.description: Add a single recipient. The rate at which recipients may be uploaded is limited to 3 requests every 2 seconds. Recipients may be uploaded in batches of 1000 per request. This results in a maximum upload rate of 1500 recipients per second.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: email
args.info: The email of the recipient.

args.name: first_name
args.info: The First Name of the recipient.

args.name: last_name
args.info: The Last Name of the recipient.

args.name: custom_field
args.info: Array key=>value with existing custom field names as key.

blocks.name: getCategoriesList
blocks.description: Retrieve a list of your categories.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: category
args.info: Performs a prefix search on this value.

args.name: limit
args.info: Optional field to limit the number of results returned. Defaults to 50.

args.name: offset
args.info: Optional beginning point in the list to retrieve from. Defaults to 0.

blocks.name: sendMail
blocks.description: This endpoint allows you to send email.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: personalizations
args.info: An array of messages and their metadata. Each object within personalizations can be thought of as an envelope - it defines who should receive an individual message and how that message should be handled. Parameters in personalizations will override the parameters of the same name from the message level. Example: [{"bcc": [{"email": "sam.doe@example.com","name": "Sam Doe"}], "cc": [{"email": "jane.doe@example.com","name": "Jane Doe"}], "custom_args": {"New Argument 1": "New Value 1","activationAttempt": "1","customerAccountNumber": "123"},"headers": {"X-Accept-Language": "en","X-Mailer": "MyApp"},"send_at": 1409348513,"subject": "Hello, World!","substitutions": {"id": "substitutions","type": "object"},"to": [ {"email": "john.doe@example.com","name": "John Doe"}]}]

args.name: from_email
args.info: The email address of the sender.

args.name: from_name
args.info: The name of the sender.

args.name: reply_to_email
args.info: The email address to which responses will be sent.

args.name: reply_to_name
args.info: The name of the individual who will receive responses to the email.

args.name: subject
args.info: The subject of your email. This may be overridden by personalizations[x].subject.

args.name: content
args.info:
An array in which you may specify the content of your email. You can include multiple mime types of content, but you must specify at least one. To include more than one mime type, simply add another object to the array containing the type and value parameters. If included, text/plain and text/html must be the first indices of the array in this order. If you choose to include the text/plain or text/html mime types, they must be the first indices of the content array in the order text/plain, text/html. Example: [{"type": "text/html","value": "Hello, world!

"}]

args.name: attachments
args.info: An array of objects in which you can specify any attachments you want to include.

args.name: template_id
args.info: The id of a template that you would like to use. If you use a template that contains content and a subject (either text or html), you do not need to specify those in the respective personalizations or message level parameters.

args.name: sections
args.info: An object of key/value pairs that define large blocks of content that can be inserted into your emails using substitution tags. Example: {"section": {":sectionName1": "section 1 text", ":sectionName2": "section 2 text"}}

args.name: headers
args.info: An object containing key/value pairs of header names and the value to substitute for them. You must ensure these are properly encoded if they contain unicode characters. Must not be any of the following reserved headers: x-sg-id, x-sg-eid, received, dkim-signature, Content-Type, Content-Transfer-Encoding, To, From, Subject, Reply-To, CC, BCC.

args.name: categories
args.info: Each category name may not exceed 255 characters. You cannot have more than 10 categories per request.

args.name: custom_args
args.info: Values according the pattern KEY:VALUE,KEY:VALUE etc., that are specific to the entire send that will be carried along with the email and its activity data. Substitutions will not be made on custom arguments, so any string that is entered into this parameter will be assumed to be the custom argument that you would like to be used. This parameter is overridden by any conflicting personalizations[x].custom_args if that parameter has been defined.

args.name: send_at
args.info: A unix timestamp allowing you to specify when you want your email to be sent from SendGrid. This is not necessary if you want the email to be sent at the time of your API request.

args.name: batch_id
args.info: This ID represents a batch of emails (AKA multiple sends of the same email) to be associated to each other for scheduling. Including a batch_id in your request allows you to include this email in that batch, and also enables you to cancel or pause the delivery of that entire batch.

args.name: asm
args.info: An object allowing you to specify how to handle unsubscribes. Use pattern group_id:value;groups_to_display:value1,value2,... etc.

args.name: ip_pool_name
args.info: The IP Pool that you would like to send this email from. Min 2, Max 64.

args.name: mail_settings_bcc_enable
args.info: Indicates if this setting is enabled.

args.name: mail_settings_bcc_email
args.info: The email address that you would like to receive the BCC.

args.name: mail_settings_bypass_list_management_enable
args.info: Indicates if this setting is enabled. Allows you to bypass all unsubscribe groups and suppressions to ensure that the email is delivered to every single recipient. This should only be used in emergencies when it is absolutely necessary that every recipient receives your email. Ex: outage emails, or forgot password emails.

args.name: mail_settings_footer_enable
args.info: Indicates if this setting is enabled. The default footer that you would like appended to the bottom of every email.

args.name: mail_settings_footer_text
args.info: The plain text content of your footer.

args.name: mail_settings_footer_html
args.info: The HTML content of your footer.

args.name: mail_settings_sandbox_mode_enable
args.info: Indicates if this setting is enabled. This allows you to send a test email to ensure that your request body is valid and formatted correctly.

args.name: mail_settings_spam_check_enable
args.info: Indicates if this setting is enabled. This allows you to test the content of your email for spam.

args.name: mail_settings_spam_check_threshold
args.info: The threshold used to determine if your content qualifies as spam on a scale from 1 to 10, with 10 being most strict, or most likely to be considered as spam.

args.name: mail_settings_spam_check_post_to_url
args.info: An Inbound Parse URL that you would like a copy of your email along with the spam report to be sent to. The post_to_url parameter must start with http or https.

args.name: tracking_settings_click_tracking_enable
args.info: Indicates if this setting is enabled. Allows you to track whether a recipient clicked a link in your email.

args.name: tracking_settings_click_tracking_enable_text
args.info: Indicates if this setting should be included in the text/plain portion of your email.

args.name: tracking_settings_open_tracking_enable
args.info: Indicates if this setting is enabled. Allows you to track whether the email was opened or not, but including a single pixel image in the body of the content. When the pixel is loaded, we can log that the email was opened.

args.name: tracking_settings_open_tracking_substitution_tag
args.info: Allows you to specify a substitution tag that you can insert in the body of your email at a location that you desire. This tag will be replaced by the open tracking pixel.

args.name: tracking_settings_subscription_tracking_enable
args.info: Indicates if this setting is enabled. Allows you to insert a subscription management link at the bottom of the text and html bodies of your email. If you would like to specify the location of the link within your email, you may use the substitution_tag.

args.name: tracking_settings_subscription_tracking_text
args.info: Text to be appended to the email, with the subscription tracking link. You may control where the link is by using the tag <% %>.

args.name: tracking_settings_subscription_tracking_html
args.info: HTML to be appended to the email, with the subscription tracking link. You may control where the link is by using the tag <% %>.

args.name: tracking_settings_subscription_tracking_substitution_tag
args.info: A tag that will be replaced with the unsubscribe URL. for example: [unsubscribe_url]. If this parameter is used, it will override both the textand html parameters. The URL of the link will be placed at the substitution tag’s location, with no additional formatting.

args.name: ganalytics_enable
args.info: Indicates if this setting is enabled. Allows you to enable tracking provided by Google Analytics.

args.name: ganalytics_utm_source
args.info: Name of the referrer source. (e.g. Google, SomeDomain.com, or Marketing Email).

args.name: ganalytics_utm_medium
args.info: Name of the marketing medium. (e.g. Email).

args.name: ganalytics_utm_term
args.info: Used to identify any paid keywords.

args.name: ganalytics_utm_content
args.info: Used to differentiate your campaign from advertisements.

args.name: ganalytics_utm_campaign
args.info: The name of the campaign.

blocks.name: sendPlainMail
blocks.description: This endpoint allows you to send email with plain text.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: fromEmail
args.info: The email address of the sender.

args.name: fromName
args.info: The name of the sender.

args.name: toEmail
args.info: The email address of the recipient.

args.name: toName
args.info: The name of the recipient.

args.name: subject
args.info: The subject of your email.

args.name: content
args.info: The actual content of your email.

blocks.name: createTemplate
blocks.description: Create a template.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the new template. Max 100 characters.

blocks.name: getTemplates
blocks.description: Retrieve all templates.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

blocks.name: getTemplate
blocks.description: Retrieve a single template.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: template_id
args.info: The ID of the template.

blocks.name: editTemplate
blocks.description: Edit a template.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: template_id
args.info: The ID of the template.

args.name: name
args.info: The new name of the template.

blocks.name: deleteTemplate
blocks.description: Delete a template.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: template_id
args.info: The ID of the template.

blocks.name: createVersion
blocks.description: Create a new version for a template.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: template_id
args.info: The ID of the template.

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the new version. Max 100 characters.

args.name: subject
args.info: Subject of the new version. <%subject%> tag must be present.

args.name: html_content
args.info: HTML content of the new version. <%body%> tag must be inside the content. Maximum of 1048576 bytes allowed for html content.

args.name: plain_content
args.info: Text/plain content of the new version. <%body%> tag must be inside the content. Maximum of 1048576 bytes allowed for plain content.

args.name: active
args.info: 0 - Inactive, 1 - Active. Set the new version as the active version associated with the template. Only one version of a template can be active. The first version created for a template will automatically be set to Active.

blocks.name: activateVersion
blocks.description: Activate a version.

args.name: api_key
args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: template_id
args.info: The ID of the template.

args.name: version_id
args.info: The ID of the version.

blocks.name: getVersion

args.info: The API key obtained from SendGrid.

args.name: template_id

args.name: version_id
args.info: The ID of the version.

args.name: subject
args.info: Subject of the new version. <%subject%> tag must be present.

args.name: html_content
args.info: HTML content of the new version. <%body%> tag must be inside the content. Maximum of 1048576 bytes allowed for html content.

args.name: plain_content
args.info: Text/plain content of the new version. <%body%> tag must be inside the content. Maximum of 1048576 bytes allowed for plain content.

args.name: active
args.info: 0 - Inactive, 1 - Active. Set the new version as the active version associated with the template. Only one version of a template can be active. The first version created for a template will automatically be set to Active.
